title: Insights from the 2026 Oscars Nominees' Class Photo
summary: The 2026 Oscars nominees' luncheon and class photo, held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles, featured prominent actors like Timothée Chalamet, Emma Stone, and Michael B Jordan. Unlike previous years, this year's photo was more subdued, with fewer exaggerated poses, possibly due to publicists advising stars to avoid social media mishaps. The Academy returned to a standing arrangement after last year's sitting debacle. Key observations include Timothée Chalamet, a best actor frontrunner, standing prominently at the front in a blue tuxedo. Guillermo del Toro added a playful touch with outstretched arms, while tall actors Jacob Elordi and Stellan Skarsgård were strategically placed in the back row. Teyana Taylor stood out in fashion with a shimmering black overcoat and is a strong supporting actress contender. The event serves as a pre-Oscars celebration, highlighting the nominees' camaraderie and individual styles.

background_read: The Oscars, officially known as the Academy Awards, are prestigious awards presented annually by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences to recognize excellence in film. The nominees' luncheon is a tradition where all Oscar nominees are invited to a formal event, often including a class photo. This photo captures the year's nominees in one image, serving as a historical record and a promotional tool. In recent years, social media has influenced how stars behave in such photos, with publicists sometimes advising against risky poses to prevent viral controversies. The 2026 photo marked a return to a standing format after issues with a sitting arrangement the previous year, reflecting the Academy's efforts to maintain decorum while celebrating cinematic achievements.
